hypothesis_content.title: Opening Range Break Failure in First 2 Hours
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regimes, when BTC breaks its first 30-minute opening range (high or low) within the first 2 hours of the trading day (00:00 UTC), but fails to sustain the move beyond 1.5x the opening range, price reverts to the opening range midpoint within 4 hours with >70% probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In neutral regimes, early session breaks often represent liquidity grabs rather than directional conviction. Market makers and algos fade false breaks when follow-through volume doesn't materialize. The opening range establishes initial equilibrium.
entry_conditions: BTC breaks 30-minute opening range high/low within first 2 hours of 00:00 UTC
Break fails to extend beyond 1.5x opening range width
Volume spikes on break but quickly declines
No major news events within 30 minutes of break

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns to opening range midpoint OR 4 hours after entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price extends beyond 2x opening range width with increasing volume

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If breaks accompanied by sustained volume increase (>30% above 20-period average) and funding rate moves in break direction, or if break occurs during scheduled macro announcements.
